title: How to Make Pina Colada Poke Cake

steps.headline: Bake the cake in a 9x13 inch (22cm x 28cm) baking pan.
steps.description: Use the original directions or instructions according to the recipe of your choice. Set the cake aside to cool completely.

steps.headline: Make the filling.
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine the cream of coconut, condensed milk, and reserved pineapple juice.

steps.headline: Make the holes in the cake.
steps.description: Use the round tip at the end of a wooden spoon to create evenly portioned holes throughout the entire cake.

steps.headline: Fill the holes with the filling mixture.
steps.description: Pour the filling over the cake, filling in the holes as best as you can. Spread the reserved crushed pineapple on top.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the cake.
steps.description: Use plastic wrap to cover the cake and place it in the refrigerator to chill for a few hours. This allows the condensed milk to absorb into the cake.

steps.headline: Make and spread the frosting.
steps.description: Use an electric hand or stand mixer to beat the whipping cream. Add the coconut extract and powdered sugar until soft peaks form. Use a rubber spatula to distribute the frosting evenly on the cake.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the cake until it's ready to be served.

text: Bake the cake in a 9x13 inch (22cm x 28cm) baking pan. Use the original directions or instructions according to the recipe of your choice. Set the cake aside to cool completely. Make the filling. In a large bowl, combine the cream of coconut, condensed milk, and reserved pineapple juice. Make the holes in the cake. Use the round tip at the end of a wooden spoon to create evenly portioned holes throughout the entire cake. Fill the holes with the filling mixture. Pour the filling over the cake, filling in the holes as best as you can. Spread the reserved crushed pineapple on top. Refrigerate the cake. Use plastic wrap to cover the cake and place it in the refrigerator to chill for a few hours. This allows the condensed milk to absorb into the cake. Make and spread the frosting. Use an electric hand or stand mixer to beat the whipping cream. Add the coconut extract and powdered sugar until soft peaks form. Use a rubber spatula to distribute the frosting evenly on the cake. Refrigerate the cake until it's ready to be served.
